Description: Indicates the rate at which segments are received by the server.
Indicates the rate at which segments are sent to clients or other servers.
Indicates the rate at which segments are being retransmitted by the server to clients/other servers.
Indicates the ratio of the rate of data retransmissions to the rate of data being sent by the server to clients/other servers.
Interpretation: Ideally, the retransmission ratio should be low (< 5%). Most often retransmissions at the TCP layer have significant impact on application performance. Very often a large number of retransmissions are caused by a congested network link, bottlenecks at a router causing buffer/queue overflows, or by lousy network links due to poor physical layer characteristics (e.g., low signal to noise ratio). By tracking the percentage of retransmissions at a server, an administrator can quickly be alerted to problem situations in the network link(s) to the server that may be impacting the service performance.
